meanings.sent1: The thought of the upcoming party preexcites me.
meanings.sent2: The music preexcites the crowd before the concert starts.
meanings.sent3: The anticipation of the surprise preexcites the children.
meanings.sent4: The smell of fresh cookies preexcites my senses.
meanings.sent5: The colorful decorations preexcite the atmosphere of the room.

meanings.definition: To cause excitement before an event or action.
meanings.sent1: The movie trailer preexcites the audience for the film.
meanings.sent2: The announcement of the game release preexcites the gamers.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a snow day preexcites the students.
meanings.sent4: The smell of popcorn preexcites the moviegoers.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the starting bell preexcites the runners at the race.
